data.title: Bouncing in a Pipe
data.solution:
next_token = string.gmatch(io.read(), "[^%s]+")
W = tonumber(next_token())
H = tonumber(next_token())
S = tonumber(io.read())
D = io.read()

line_pos = S
moving_right = D == "\\"

for i=1,H do
    line = "|"

    for j=2,W-1 do
        if j == line_pos + 1 then
            line = line..(moving_right and "\\" or "/")
        else
            line = line.." "
        end
    end
    
    line = line.."|"
    print(line)

    if moving_right then
        line_pos = line_pos + 1

        if line_pos == W - 1 then
            moving_right = false
            line_pos = W - 2
        end
    else
        line_pos = line_pos - 1

        if line_pos == 0 then
            moving_right = true
            line_pos = 1
        end
    end
end

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You must output a line bouncing back and forth inside a pipe using ASCII

* The walls of the pipe are represented by |
* The line is represented by \ and /

The width of the pipe W represents the total width, including the walls.
The starting column S is 0-indexed, starting from the column containing the left wall. This starting position is always in the first row of the pipe, and will always be between the left and right walls of the pipe.
Input
Line 1: Two space-separated integers W and H for the width and height of the pipe
Line 2: An integer S for the starting column of the path
Line 3: A character D for the starting direction of the path, either \ or /
Output
H lines of the path through the pipe
Constraints
3 ≤ W ≤ 10
3 ≤ H ≤ 20
0 < S < W - 1
Example
Input
4 7
1
/
Output
|/ |
|\ |
| \|
| /|
|/ |
|\ |
| \|
